File#

struct FileDeleter#

Custom Deleter type for smart pointers to provide scoped closing of owned std::FILE handles.

class File#

Basic scoped file type providing formatted output and byte and character input.

Example: 

auto file = File::open(std::filesystem::path("/home/username/example.txt"),
                       {.type = File::AccessType::Write,
                        .modifier = File::AccessModifier::Truncate})
            .expect("Failed to open example file!");
file.println("Hello world!");

Public Types

enum class AccessType : u32#

The type of access permission to open a file with.

Values:

enumerator Read#
enumerator Write#
enumerator ReadWrite#
enum AccessModifier#

The access permission modifiers to open a file with.

Values:

enumerator None#
enumerator Append#
enumerator Truncate#
enumerator Binary#
enumerator FailIfExists#
enum class SeekOrigin : i32#

Position to seek from when seeking in a file.

Values:

enumerator Begin#
enumerator Current#
enumerator End#

Public Functions

File() = delete#

a File can’t be default-constructed

inline constexpr File(std::FILE *file, OpenOptions options = {AccessType::ReadWrite, AccessModifier::Truncate}) noexcept#

Constructs a File from the given std::FILE* handle with the given OpenOptions

Parameters

  • file – - The handle to the open file

  • options – - The OpenOptions the file was opened with

inline constexpr File(std::FILE *file, UniquePtr<buffer_type> &&buffer, OpenOptions options = {AccessType::ReadWrite, AccessModifier::Truncate}) noexcept#

Constructs a File from the given std::FILE* handle with the given OpenOptions

Parameters

  • file – - The handle to the open file

  • buffer – - The userspace buffer associated with the opened file for buffering

  • options – - The OpenOptions the file was opened with

File(const File&) = delete#

a File can’t be copy-constructed

inline constexpr File(File &&file) noexcept#

Move-constructs a File from the given one.

template<typename ...Args>
inline auto print(fmt::format_string<Args...> &&format_string, Args&&... args) noexcept -> Result<i32>#

Prints the formatted string to the file.

Formats the given arguments into the given format string, and prints the result to the file. If printing is successful, returns an implementation defined i32 (corresponds exactly with the system’s std::fputs implementation). If printing is unsuccessful OR the file wasn’t opened with write access, returns an error.

Template Parameters

Args – - The types of the arguments to format into the format string

Parameters

  • format_string – - The format string to print to the file

  • args – - The arguments to format into the format string

Returns

Ok(i32) on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

template<typename ...Args>
inline auto println(fmt::format_string<Args...> &&format_string, Args&&... args) noexcept -> Result<i32>#

Prints the formatted string to the file, followed by a newline.

Formats the given arguments into the given format string, and prints the result, followed by a newline, to the file. If printing is successful, returns an implementation defined i32 (corresponds exactly with the system’s std::fputs implementation). If printing is unsuccessful OR the file wasn’t opened with write access, returns an error.

Template Parameters

Args – - The types of the arguments to format into the format string

Parameters

  • format_string – - The format string to print to the file

  • args – - The arguments to format into the format string

Returns

Ok(i32) on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

template<usize NumBytes>
inline auto write_bytes(const byte (&bytes)[NumBytes]) noexcept -> Result<i32>#

Writes the bytes from bytes to the file.

Writes the bytes from bytes to the file. If writing is successful, returns an implementation-defined i32 (corresponds exactly with the system’s std::fputs implementation). If writing was unsuccessful OR the file wasn’t opened with write access, returns an error.

Template Parameters

NumBytes – - The number of bytes to write

Parameters

bytes – - The bytes to write

Returns

Ok(std::string) if successful, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto write_bytes(usize num_bytes, const byte *bytes) noexcept -> Result<i32>#

Writes num_bytes bytes from bytes to the file.

Writes num_bytes bytes from bytes to the file. If writing is successful, returns an implementation-defined i32 (corresponds exactly with the system’s std::fputs implementation). If writing was unsuccessful OR the file wasn’t opened with write access, returns an error.

Parameters

  • num_bytes – - The number of bytes to write

  • bytes – - The bytes to write

Returns

Ok(std::string) if successful, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto read(usize num_chars) noexcept -> Result<std::string>#

Reads up to num_chars characters from the file.

Reads up to num_chars characters from the file and returns the characters as a std::string. May read less than num_chars if EOF is encountered before num_chars have been read. If the file wasn’t opened with read access OR an error occurs while reading the characters, an error is returned.

Parameters

num_chars – - The number of characters to read

Returns

Ok(std::string) if successful, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto read_bytes(usize num_bytes) noexcept -> Result<UniquePtr<byte[]>>#

Reads up to num_bytes bytes from the file.

Reads up to num_bytes bytes from the file and returns the bytes as a UniquePtr<byte[]>. May read less than num_bytes if EOF is encountered before num_bytes have been read. If the file wasn’t opened with read access OR an error occurs while reading the characters, an error is returned.

Parameters

num_bytes – - The number of bytes to read

Returns

Ok(std::string) if successful, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto read_line() noexcept -> Result<std::string>#

Reads up to one text line from the file.

Reads up to one text line from the file and returns the line as a std::string. May read less than a line if EOF is encountered before an end line character has been read. If the file wasn’t opened with read access OR an error occurs while reading the characters, an error is returned.

Returns

Ok(std::string) if successful, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto flush() noexcept -> Result<>#

Flushes the file’s buffer, forcing buffered output to be written.

Flushes the file’s buffer, forcing buffered output to be written to the file. Returns an Err(error::SystemError) if an error occurs when flushing OR if the file wasn’t opened with write access (Hyperion does not support using implementation-defined flush behavior for input streams). On success, returns an empty Result<>

Returns

Ok() on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto seek(i64 offset, SeekOrigin origin = SeekOrigin::Current) noexcept -> Result<>#

Seeks within the file to the position at offset, relative to the given seek origin.

Parameters

  • offset – The offset from the seek origin to seek to

  • origin – The origin from which to seek

Returns

Ok() on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto position() noexcept -> Result<usize>#

Returns the current position in the file, relative to the beginning of the file.

Returns

The position in the file on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto size() noexcept -> Result<usize>#

Returns the size of the file in bytes.

Returns

The size of the file on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

auto operator=(const File&) -> File& = delete#

Files can’t be copy-assigned

inline constexpr auto operator=(File &&file) noexcept -> File&#

Move-assigns this file from the given one.

Public Static Functions

static auto validate_open_options(OpenOptions options) noexcept -> Result<const char*>#

Validates the given OpenOptions and returns the corresponding C standard access mode string if they are valid.

Parameters

options – - The OpenOptions to validate

Returns

The C standard access mode string if the options are valid, otherwise an error

static auto open(const std::filesystem::path &path, OpenOptions open_options, usize buffer_size) noexcept -> Result<File>#

Attempts to open the file located at the given path

Attempts to open the file located at path with the given open_options and associated buffer_size. If opening the file and associating a buffer with it is successful, returns the resulting Ok(File). Otherwise, returns an Err(error::SystemError).

Parameters

  • path – - The path to the file to open

  • open_options – - The file access options to open the file with

  • buffer_size – - The size of the userspace buffer to associate with the file

Returns

Ok(File) on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

static auto open(const std::filesystem::path &path, OpenOptions open_options) noexcept -> Result<File>#

Attempts to open the file located at the given path

Attempts to open the file located at path with the given open_options and default buffer size. If opening the file and associating a buffer with it is successful, returns the resulting Ok(File). Otherwise, returns an Err(error::SystemError).

Parameters

  • path – - The path to the file to open

  • open_options – - The file access options to open the file with

Returns

Ok(File) on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

static auto open(const std::filesystem::path &path) noexcept -> Result<File>#

Attempts to open the file located at the given path

Attempts to open the file located at path with the default access options and default buffer size. If opening the file and associating a buffer with it is successful, returns the resulting Ok(File). Otherwise, returns an Err(error::SystemError).

Parameters

path – - The path to the file to open

Returns

Ok(File) on success, Err(error::SystemError) on failure

Public Static Attributes

static constexpr usize DEFAULT_FILE_BUFFER_SIZE = HYPERION_PLATFORM_WINDOWS ? 8192_usize : BUFSIZ#

The default size for a File’s associated user-space buffer.

struct OpenOptions#

The access permission options to open a file with.

The type can be any of File::AccessType. The modifier can be any bitwise combination of File::AccessModifier.

Only combinations equivalent with valid access mode strings in the C standard are valid. For example, a .modifier of AccessModifier::Append | AccessModifier::FailIfExists is invalid and a combination of .type == AccessType::Read and .modifier == AccessModifier::Truncate is invalid

inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator|(const File::AccessModifier &lhs, const File::AccessModifier &rhs) noexcept -> u32#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator|(const File::AccessModifier &lhs, u32 rhs) noexcept -> u32#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator|(u32 lhs, const File::AccessModifier &rhs) noexcept -> u32#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator&(const File::AccessModifier &lhs, const File::AccessModifier &rhs) noexcept -> u32#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator&(const File::AccessModifier &lhs, u32 rhs) noexcept -> u32#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator&(u32 lhs, const File::AccessModifier &rhs) noexcept -> u32#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator~(const File::AccessModifier &mod) noexcept -> u32#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator==(const File::AccessModifier &lhs, u32 rhs) noexcept -> bool#
inline constexpr auto hyperion::fs::operator==(u32 lhs, const File::AccessModifier &rhs) noexcept -> bool#
